column4: Can I use OpenJDK for Libreoffice and Oracle Java for Firefox?
I'll try, just installed oracle java from a ppa
why you all want to use ppas?
oracle java is better supported by browser apps, and not available in ubuntu
well, you can try with the packet default-jdk etc.
I thought I could safely install openjdk7 instead.
I am nearly sure that that would break things. There are a lot of programs just for J6
you can specify the classpath etc.
thanks for the hint. I hoped libreoffice would support openjdk7 already, didn't check.
no, the display wouldn't work correctly, when switching channels
I think is because of the key shortcuts
https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=664858 seems to be due to my nvidia card too
doomrobo " we have to invent entirely new GL extensions" is the last post
Well I need shortcuts anyway. In virtualbox there were no problems by the way. :)
I will stand in 11.10 till they resolve those sort of things...
